title.narrative: EDUCATION DRR/RESILIENCE

description.narrative: The education system at all levels has increased capacity to build resilience and prepare children and school communities to respond to emergencies and disasters particularly in target countries.,which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, more pre-primary, primary and lower secondary school aged and school-aged children particularly the most vulnerable, are in school and learning.

mailing-address.narrative: 3rd & 5th Floors FDB Building 360 Victoria Parade Suva

sector.narrative: Provision or procurement of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) learning materials
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The education system at all levels has increased capacity to build resilience and prepare children and school communities to respond to emergencies and disasters particularly in target countries.

description.narrative: Vanuatu, Fiji, Tonga and Solomon Islands, four of the highest disaster risk countries in the world, developed and launched implementation for a School-Based Disaster Risk Reduction (SBDRR) programme and trained officials and school committee members from all schools in target districts in advance of the cyclone season. Vanuatu and Solomon Islands initiated and continued emergency response efforts as well. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2019
